de.mrapp.android.sidebar.view

Class ContentView

  • java.lang.Object
    • FrameLayout
      • de.mrapp.android.sidebar.view.ContentView

  • public class ContentView
extends FrameLayout
    A custom view, which contains the content view of a sidebar, as well as a view, which is used as an overlay, while the sidebar is shown.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ContentView(Context context, Inflater inflater, int overlayColor)
      Creates a new custom view, which contains the content view of a sidebar, as well as a view, which is used as an overlay, while the sidebar is shown.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      View getContentView()
      Returns the content view.
      int getOverlayColor()
      Returns the current color of the overlay.
      float getOverlayTransparency()
      Returns the current transparency of the overlay.
      void setOverlayColor(int overlayColor)
      Sets the color of the overlay.
      void setOverlayTransparency(float transparency)
      Sets the transparency of the overlay.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContentView

        public ContentView(Context context,
           Inflater inflater,
           int overlayColor)
        Creates a new custom view, which contains the content view of a sidebar, as well as a view, which is used as an overlay, while the sidebar is shown.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the view should belong to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        inflater - The inflater, which should be used to inflate the content view, as an instance of the type Inflater. The inflater may not be null
        overlayColor - The color of the overlay as an Integer value

    • Method Detail

      • getOverlayTransparency

        public final float getOverlayTransparency()
        Returns the current transparency of the overlay.
        Returns:
        The current transparency of the overlay as a Float value. If set to 0.0, the overlay is completely transparent, if set to 1.0, the overlay is not transparent at all

      • setOverlayTransparency

        public final void setOverlayTransparency(float transparency)
        Sets the transparency of the overlay.
        Parameters:
        transparency - The transparency, which should be set, as a Float value. If set to 0.0, the overlay will be completely transparent, if set to 1.0, the overlay will not be transparent at all

      • getOverlayColor

        public final int getOverlayColor()
        Returns the current color of the overlay.
        Returns:
        The current color of the overlay as an Integer value

      • setOverlayColor

        public final void setOverlayColor(int overlayColor)
        Sets the color of the overlay.
        Parameters:
        overlayColor - The color, which should be set, as an Integer value

      • getContentView

        public final View getContentView()
        Returns the content view.
        Returns:
        The content view, as an instance of the class View. The content view may not be null
